text: sorry but idk if moving really changes things that much? sorta feels like you carry your old self wherever you go no matter the scenery swap 🏙️🔄🌳
historical finds =/= ghosts but don't downplay their worth tho
cool finds actually give real context to our past👀 just not ghost stuff - still super fascinating minus haunt vibes!
life’s more rough draft than final copy tbh
feels like every month brings some surprise expense - so much for "predictable" bills 😒 huge myth tbh
budget’s more like dodgeball these days 🏐
higher income ≠ need for material stuff; more freedom to choose imo 👍
academia vs real-world gigs - totally diff story 😤💯
ugh totally get you! film school seems all cool until u realize it's less quentin tarantino & more coffee runs than expected 😂 gotta roll with those punches tho!
film school vibes different - doesn't always match reality tho
yeah feels like all theories crumble under job market pressure
crazy stuff happens - saw someone buy 100 pumpkin spice syrups once 🎃🤣
yeah even slinging coffee gets you pigeonholed sometimes - legit skills get overlooked cuz they expect you're just riding out some phase until "a real job" comes calling
skill doesn't always beat old habits 😒
not surprised tbh, some customers see me just serving coffee when i'm juggling much more behind the counter 🙄
honestly think everyone romanticizes things too much early on - just keep it real rather than overthinking 'us vs. me' stuff so soon!
real growth happens inside too - gotta both be evolving 🌀
but what if goals change?
glue's not just warm fuzzy feelings; it’s also splitting Netflix bills without drama
def takes teamwork & real talk
teaming up sounds cute but feels kinda constraining - lifelong solo artist? 🤔
real talk tho - we grow films where everything wraps up neatly incl romance which isn’t reality? just think solid relationships are part masterpiece part blooper reel 😂🎬
def more everyday compatibility n' respect than fate tbh
bet they're not unchanged, just unnoticed changes happening tbh
big cities can dilute those vibes though
older techniques had soul though
yeah busier cities just don't get chill backyard vibes right?
scheduled bbqs just lack that spontaneous fun factor tbh...kinda makes you miss homegrown traditions sometimes huh?
